alert.note: Alert for Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:19PM EST until January 05 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL LATE TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely. Cooler air works southward across the region tonight and tomorrow changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow (confined mainly to the north), sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. Freezing drizzle is likely at times afterward with light snow occasionally mixing in. Further south, temperatures will take longer to cool however freezing drizzle and some freezing rain will be possible at times through the daylight hours of Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...In Maine, Southern Oxford County. In New Hampshire, Northern Carroll, Northern Grafton, and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected tonight into Thursday with air temperatures falling below freezing after midnight. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. A slippery Thursday morning commute is expected with slippery conditions perhaps continuing into the afternoon and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will be less intense during the day Thursday however freezing drizzle may still produce hazardous driving conditions, especially on untreated roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
